intro: Cryptantha ganderi, commonly known as the Gander's bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its seed pods are cylindrical and split open when mature. Cryptantha ganderi is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
